title: How to Create and Play "Beach in a Bottle"

steps.headline: Find an appropriate work surface.
steps.description: Since this project is going to involve a lot of sand, you may want to work out side or put newspaper down under a table or counter.

steps.headline: Put all the required materials on your work surface.
steps.description: Remove the labels and glue from the jar. Pour the sand about 1 ⁄2 inches (3.8 cm) into the jar.

steps.headline: Check for spilled sand on the work surface and push it aside before you proceed.
Add as many shells or fish as you want.
steps.description: Your fish need to be dried or plastic. Do not fill the jar all the way up, as you will not be able to play.

steps.headline: Retrieve the cap to your jar, and paint it, use a paint brush.
steps.description: Let it dry overnight. While you have this drying it is best to cover your jar and contents using cling-wrap. You could also paint the lid before you do anything else, or, not bother to paint the lid at all.

steps.headline: Let the paint dry.
steps.description: Place a ring of hot-glue upon the inside of the cap. Screw the cap on and press firmly. Repeat this step if the glue doesn't stick. Let the glue dry.

steps.headline: Admire your beach in a bottle or play the game.
Shake up the bottle every time for a new game.
Keep turning and twisting the bottle around to try to get all the fishies and shells to the top of the sand, towards the lid of the jar.
Try other games.
steps.description: You may also want to try getting the shells and fish to the bottom, or "racing" the shells/fishies.

text: Creating the Game Find an appropriate work surface. Since this project is going to involve a lot of sand, you may want to work out side or put newspaper down under a table or counter. Put all the required materials on your work surface. Remove the labels and glue from the jar. Pour the sand about 1 ⁄2 inches (3.8 cm) into the jar. Check for spilled sand on the work surface and push it aside before you proceed. You can clean it later. Add as many shells or fish as you want. Your fish need to be dried or plastic. Do not fill the jar all the way up, as you will not be able to play. Retrieve the cap to your jar, and paint it, use a paint brush. Let it dry overnight. While you have this drying it is best to cover your jar and contents using cling-wrap. You could also paint the lid before you do anything else, or, not bother to paint the lid at all. Let the paint dry. Place a ring of hot-glue upon the inside of the cap. Screw the cap on and press firmly. Repeat this step if the glue doesn't stick. Let the glue dry. Clean up the mess.  Admire your beach in a bottle or play the game.  Playing the game Shake up the bottle every time for a new game.  Keep turning and twisting the bottle around to try to get all the fishies and shells to the top of the sand, towards the lid of the jar.  Try other games. You may also want to try getting the shells and fish to the bottom, or "racing" the shells/fishies.
